goals__remit:
EPA gathers the parents associations in Europe which together represent more than 150 million parents. EPA works in partnership both to represent and give to parents a powerful voice in the development of policies and decisions at European level concerning children and their parents. In the field of education, EPA aims to promote the active participation of parents and the recognition of their central place as the primary responsible of the education of their children. 
EPA - the European Parents` Association - was founded in April 1985 in Milan Italy to establish an association of parents and families from all over Europe. The needs and interests of parents have been the focus of EPA activities since then. 
As one of the main concerns of parents is the child`s education in a holistic approach, permanent work was tributed to this field.  EPA`s position is that a partnership of parents and teachers will give the optimum conditions for the child`s education. 
The statutes was last adjusted in 2014. While the legal seat is in Belgium, during the years the office moved to the Netherlands, Spain and is now in Austria. 
EPA supports the participation and collaboration of parents in many educational respects by: 
•    Gathering and disseminating information by means of EPA publications including, newsletters, seminar reports, EPA website, discussion forums. •    Highlighting innovation in educational partnership and spreading information about interesting and innovative educational practices. 
•    Promoting parents’ ongoing support and training. 
•    Supporting research in all fields relating to the participation of he parents in the educational environment. 
Collaboration with various partners in the broad field of education.
relevant_communication:
Projects EPA is involved (or recently was) in: 
- European Policy Network on School Leadership 
- SIRIUS - Network on Migrant Education 
- KeyCoNet 
- ELICIT Plus - European Literacy and Citizenship Education 
- FamilyEduNet - educating parents for active involvement 
- ParentNets - parenting in the digital age 
- ParentHelp - support programme for migrant parents in 16 countries 
- SEQUENCES - quality in early childhood education institutions 
- ELITe - STEM teacher training 
- ELPIDA - inclusion of parents of children with mental disabilites 
- Open School Doors - inclusion of disadvantaged parents, especially of migrant background  
- research on school costs in Europe 
- reserach on parental involvement and child participation in education 
 
EPA is engaged in the activities of both EUCIS-LLL and the Social Platform to boost impact of communication. EPA is also engaged in the Alliance for Childhood and the Alliance for Investing in Children as well as in the Learning for Well-Being Community. EPA has joined SIRIUS aisbl to support migrant education 
 
Publications: 
- The best interest of the young child - policy paper on early childhood education and work-life balance 
- Manifesto 2015 on 21st century education and parenting 
- Position Paper on Social Networks and Cyberbullying 
- Reconciliation Issues for Parents in Europe 
- regular monthly newsletters, website and blog 
- activities on social networks (Facebook, Twitter) 
- contribution to the Implementation Handbook and Toolkit of the Alliance for Investing in Children 
- contribution to the School Leadership Toolkit, chapter on Collaboration 
- MOOC on parenting for educational success 
- training course for mixed audiences of school heads, teachers, parents, children and others
